meaning: to make an object sharp
sentence1: His physique was honed to perfection.
sentence2: The bone had been honed to a point.

meaning: unreasonable or unsuitable because of being based on bad judgment or on wrong information or beliefs
sentence1: He was shot as he made a misguided attempt to stop the robbers single-handed.
wordsentence2: The company blamed its disappointing performance on a misguided business plan.

meaning: a person who is extremely skilled at something, especially at playing an instrument or performing
sentence1: The world’s greatest tenor treated us to a virtuoso display of his abundant talent.
sentence2: Famous mainly for his wonderful voice, Cole was also a virtuoso on the piano.

meaning: to fail to include or do something
sentence1: She omitted to mention that she would be away next week.
sentence2: I’d be upset if my name were omitted from the list of contributors.

meaning: (used especially in place names) an island
sentence1: The Isle of Skye.
sentence2: Explore now the more remote Caribbean isles!

meaning: something such as a very short poem or a special word used to help a person remember something
sentence1: I think music has a tremendous mnemonic power.
sentence2: Rhyme's mnemonic qualities are part of understanding its effects.

meaning: to avoid something by going around it; to ignore a rule
sentence1: The oil pipeline bypasses the protected wilderness area.
sentence2: They bypassed the committee and went straight to senior management.

meaning: to form a false understanding of the meaning or intention of something that someone does or says
sentence1: She said Harris had misconstrued her comments.
sentence2: Their caution was misconstrued as cowardice.

meaning: to become less intense or severe; to make something less intense or severe
sentence1: With bated breath we waited for the storm to pass but during the entire night it didn't show signs of abating.
sentence2: They waited for the crowd’s fury to abate.

meaning: central and important
sentence1: He plays a pivotal figure/role in the story.
sentence2: She played a pivotal role in the civil rights movement.

meaning: not accurate or exact
sentence1: Maybe your world view is a little skewed, flat earther!
sentence2: Her smile often is slightly skewed.

meaning: to express to someone your strong official disapproval of them
sentence1: Her boss gave her a severe reprimand for being late.
sentence2: He was reprimanded by her teacher for biting another girl.

meaning: the number below the line in a fraction
sentence1: In the fraction ¾, 4 is the denominator.
sentence2: A number of chapters in the volume do not support that common denominator.

meaning: to (cause something to) explode, break, or tear
sentence1: This news has ruptured (= violently ended) the delicate peace between the rival groups.
sentence2: a rupture of the pipeline.

meaning: things that are for eating
sentence1: We have brought back some fascinating new comestibles.
sentence2: She bought comestibles and a couple of other things from the store.

meaning: an inaugural event is the first in a series of planned events
sentence1: He plans to be on the inaugural flight when the twinjet aircraft goes into service next month.
sentence2: He held an inaugural ceremony last Saturday.

meaning: a person or thing that shows that sth is going to happen soon, especially sth bad
sentence1: A more disruptive factor lies with the warming of the oceans, a probable harbinger of the greenhouse effect.
sentence2: That's certainly not a harbinger of doom!

meaning: to explain something more than necessary
sentence1: There's no need to belabor the point.
sentence2: I don’t want to belabor the point, but it’s vital you understand how important this is.

meaning: a piece of rope, chain, etc. tied to an animal, especially to a dog at its collar when taking it for a walk
sentence1: Please keep your dog on a leash when on the beach.
sentence2: Dogs must be kept on a leash in this park.

meaning: to increase someone's interest in and wish for something, usually by giving them a small experience of it
sentence1: This will whet your appetite for more.
sentence2: That one kiss had whetted his appetite.

meaning: to force someone to do something
sentence1: The managers bludgeoned us into agreeing to the changes.
sentence2: A heavy stick that is thick at one end and which can be used as a weapon is called a buldgeon.

meaning: to steal things of small value or to steal money, ideas, information, etc. from an organization
sentence1: He was caught pilfering (sweets) from the shop.
sentence2: They were charged with conspiracy to pilfer $600m from a major international conglomerate.

meaning: belonging to or happening in a past time
sentence1: The empty factories are relics of a bygone era.
sentence2: Just let bygones be bygones and be friends again.

meaning: to spread opinions, lies, or beliefs among a lot of people
sentence1: Such lies are propagated in the media.
sentence2: Light and sound propagate at vastly different speeds.

meaning: the process of getting supplies; the process by which an organization buys the products or services from other organizations
sentence1: He vows to cut procurement costs 10% by halving the number of global suppliers.
sentence2: We must ensure that the process follows strict procurment rules.

meaning: pleasantly juicy
sentence1: Succulent food is juicy and delicious.
sentence2: The sirloin is a quality piece of meat, tender and succulent.

meaning: a very large rock
sentence1: The earlier parts of the castle constructions are characterised by heavy granite boulder constructions.
sentence2: His adventurous-spirited mother loved skiing, hiking, and bouldering.
